DataElement.preferredName: Bone Metastasis Biochemical Disease Progression Present Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient had spread of the cancer diagnosed using biochemical markers specific for the disease or as bone metastasis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Metastasis Biochemical Disease Progression Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the increase in size of a tumor, as determined by biochemical evaluation, or spread of cancer to a bone, being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:Biochemical; of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms.:Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
Of or relating to biochemistry; involving chemical processes in living organisms.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient developed new
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed new bone metastases, a first biochemical progression, or developed an indication for radiation therapy to the bone that has not been previously reported?

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Disease Response Ind-3 (2018751v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
